text:
suggestion just for sanity’s sake, change “<http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-modules>” to “<http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-tags>” and redirect the old link to the new link.

I get it’s a minor thing, but if you’re going to change the technical terms, it’d be nice if it’s consistent
it's like Google's Search Console which still uses the `webmasters/tools/` url lol
maybe it’s that way to help time traveling web developers get to the right page. That’s my theory, I’m sticking to it. :watch:

Is it possible to get a Selector in the new design manager for Author selectors?  Simple reasoning is that sometimes we have people collab on an article and we'd like to credit the multiple authors. I already wrote something that can do this but having a selector would make the code much easier to use.
Neat idea. Haven’t had a client ask for something quite like this but could see it happening.
Yea i developed it for our use because we often will have collabs but the hardest is then who does it show up under when looking at author recent posts... both or just one?
with how it sits now, its basically under the primary author and the rest just contribute.
changed to -tags, fixing the redirect now
